definition: to advance/to step forward
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly

sentences.english: The policeman nailed the suspect with a flying tackle.
sentences.chinese: 警察飞身上前，一把抱住了嫌疑犯。

sentences.english: As he approached Goliath , what did he say?
sentences.chinese: 当他上前迎战的时候，他对歌利亚说的什么呢？

sentences.english: I went over to hold Eden. The stripes on her blanket were green.
sentences.chinese: 我上前抱住了伊甸，包裹她的小毯子是白底绿纹的。

sentences.english: After a while, Pao-yu could wait no longer, so he stepped forward and removed the veil.
sentences.chinese: 又过了一会，宝玉实在按捺不住，上前揭了盖头。

sentences.english: Mining minister said immediately come forward to clarify earlier in the ghost story.
sentences.chinese: 采臣见状立即上前澄清早前遇鬼的说法。

sentences.english: The little tailor stepped up and bowed.
Heidi ran forward to wish good-morning to him and the goats.
sentences.chinese: 海蒂跑上前向他们问好。

sentences.english: SunQiMing cannot bear to see, he came near and comfort on the girl.
sentences.chinese: 孙启鸣看不惯，于是上前安慰起那个女孩。

sentences.english: They came to him, clasped his feet and worshiped him.
sentences.chinese: 她们就上前抱住他的脚拜他。

sentences.english: Upon seeing him, Callisto rushed to him and tried calling his name.
sentences.chinese: 克丽丝桃一看到他，便冲上前试着叫他的名字。

sentences.english: Ye Xinyong dare stepped forward to help the patient.
sentences.chinese: 叶欣勇敢的上前，帮助了这位病人。

sentences.english: Although it entered the top five, the total number of visitors has decreased by 26%.
sentences.chinese: 虽然排上前五名，但是总人次已减少了26%。

sentences.english: The fox quickly picked up the piece of meat and ran off.
sentences.chinese: 狐狸急忙上前，叨起那块肉，跑开了。

sentences.english: And would you turn the other cheek?
sentences.chinese: 左脸被打，你愿意把右脸送上前么？

sentences.english: ObjectiveTo discuss the methods for the impaction of maxillary anterior teeth.
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨上前牙阻生的治疗方法。

definition: upon seeing this, .../in response, ...
promptly/at once
to hurry/to hasten/to make haste
to stop/to bar the way
hastily
to reach out with one's hand/to hold out a hand/(fig.) to beg/to get involved/to meddle
to get up/to leave/to set forth
in a great rush/in a flurry
aside/to the side of
to hint/to indicate (an idea to sb)
at once/on the spot
to be just about to/to be on the point of
to stand up
(of children, parents etc) at one's side/living with one
the front (of)/(in) front/(in) sb's presence/just before (a date)
to turn one's head/to turn around
to lend an arm to support sb
